Adidas Mobile App Pricing Slip

September 2, 2024 7:40 AM EST Bandar's Bounties

On September 2, 2024, the Adidas mobile app deployed a broken price feed that pulled from an internal testing database. Every product in the app displayed prices 60-70% below the desktop website. Ultraboost running shoes showed $42 instead of $190. Yeezy slides? $15.

Bandar's Bounties' app monitoring systems caught the discrepancy at 7:40 AM EST when mobile and desktop prices diverged dramatically. The alert specified: mobile app only, not the website.

Product page with glitched price Swipe for more
Price comparison screenshot Swipe for more
Cart view with error Swipe for more

Members scrambled to download the Adidas app and start checking out. The prices were real — orders confirmed at the app's displayed prices with full order confirmation emails. Forum channels exploded with screenshots of $30 Yeezys and $25 Stan Smiths.

Checkout total screenshot Swipe for more
Payment confirmation Swipe for more
Order email receipt Swipe for more

Adidas pushed a hotfix to the app by 10 AM, but the mobile-only nature of the glitch meant it went undetected longer than usual. All confirmed orders shipped within the week, and members received authentic Adidas products at testing-database prices.

Shipping confirmation Swipe for more
Package arrival photo Swipe for more
Unboxing / product reveal Swipe for more

Mobile app glitches are becoming more common as retailers rush to ship updates. Bandar's Bounties monitors both web and app channels so nothing slips through.

Don't Miss Out

Glitches like this happen every week. Bandar's Bounties members are always first.

Join Now

Glitch Details

Retailer
Adidas
Date
September 2, 2024
Time Spotted
7:40 AM EST
Discount
70% Below Desktop
Products
Ultraboost 23, Yeezy Slides, Stan Smith, Adidas Forum Low, Samba OG
Status
All Orders Shipped
